title: 110_s2320
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Kidney Transplant Patients Act of 2007" provides appropriate coverage of immunosuppressive drugs under the Medicare program for kidney transplant recipients. The Act ensures continued coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients under the Medicare program. Amendments are made to sections of the Social Security Act to extend coverage for these drugs. "Eligibility for benefits under this title has ended except for coverage of immunosuppressive drugs. The individual will be deemed enrolled for drug coverage but must pay the full premium. Drug provision is subject to deductible and coinsurance. Inpatient status may affect coverage." The individual is entitled to coverage of immunosuppressive drugs if they are an inpatient of a hospital. The Secretary will establish procedures to identify beneficiaries for drug coverage and distinguish them from those enrolled for the complete package of benefits. Technical amendments will be made to the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to extend secondary payer requirements for ESRD beneficiaries regarding immunosuppressive drugs. The amendments apply to drugs furnished after the date of enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. PLANS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS FOR KIDNEY TRANSPLANT RECIPIENTS. This section amends the Public Health Service Act to require coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients under certain health insurance plans. The Comprehensive Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage for Kidney Transplant Patients Act of 2007 mandates group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients. This requirement is to be as comprehensive as the coverage provided before the enactment of the Act. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Public Health Service Act. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section regarding immunosuppressive drug coverage for kidney transplant patients. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section regarding coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to require group health plans to provide comprehensive coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients. Amendments include updating section 732(a) and the table of contents. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new item after section 713. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include comprehensive coverage of immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients under group health plans, effective for plan years starting on or after January 1, 2008.
